id: My Hero Academia Live-Action Movie Reportedly in Development
paragraph:
A live-action adaptation of the popular anime and manga series My Hero Academia is reportedly in the works.Per Nerdist and The Hollywood Reporter, Legendary Entertainment made the announcement that this live-action feature film will adapt Kohei Horikoshi’s manga, with Toho distributing the movie in Japan. Legendary will be producing the film with Alex Garcia and Jay Ashenfelter, alongside Shonen Jump publisher Shueisha’s Ryosuke Yoritomi. No details concerning directors, casting or potential release dates have been announced.

Legendary Entertainment has a full slate of feature films, with the Ryan Reynolds-led Detective Pikachu live-aciton/CGI hybrid, Godzilla: King of the Monsters and Godzilla vs. Kong all currently in development.For more on My Hero Academia, check out our review of My Hero One’s Justice which we called “Good,” as well as our review for My Hero Academia: Two Heroes, the series’ most recent anime film adaptation to hit North America.
